[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@microsoft/teamsfx](./teamsfx.md) &gt; [TeamsFx](./teamsfx.teamsfx.md) &gt; [login](./teamsfx.teamsfx.login.md)

## TeamsFx.login() method

Popup login page to get user's access token with specific scopes.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
login(scopes: string | string[]): Promise<void>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  scopes | string \| string\[\] | The list of scopes for which the token will have access, before that, we will request user to consent. |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;void&gt;

## Exceptions

[InternalError](./teamsfx.errorcode.md) when failed to login with unknown error.

[ConsentFailed](./teamsfx.errorcode.md) when user canceled or failed to consent.

[InvalidParameter](./teamsfx.errorcode.md) when scopes is not a valid string or string array.

[RuntimeNotSupported](./teamsfx.errorcode.md) when runtime is nodeJS.

## Remarks

Only works in Teams client APP. User will be redirected to the authorization page to login and consent.

## Example


```typescript
await teamsfx.login(["https://graph.microsoft.com/User.Read"]); // single scope using string array
await teamsfx.login("https://graph.microsoft.com/User.Read"); // single scopes using string
await teamsfx.login(["https://graph.microsoft.com/User.Read", "Calendars.Read"]); // multiple scopes using string array
await teamsfx.login("https://graph.microsoft.com/User.Read Calendars.Read"); // multiple scopes using string
```
